intro: Aria cheddarensis, commonly known as the Cheddara lily, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates with cool winters and warm summers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a dense rosette at the base. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aria cheddarensis is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
